title.text: The University of Maryland SENSEVAL-3 System Descriptions

abstractContent.text: For SENSEVAL-3, the University of Maryland (UMD) team focused on two primary issues: the portability of sense disambigation across languages, and the exploitation of real-world bilingual text as a resource for unsupervised sense tagging.

entities.text: portability of sense disambigation across languages

abstractContent.text: We validated the portability of our supervised disambigua-tion approach by applying it in seven tasks (En-glish, Basque, Catalan, Chinese, Romanian, Span-ish, and "multilingual" lexical samples), and we experimented with anew unsupervised algorithm for sense modeling using parallel corpora.
